<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 378, 145]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 348, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0606/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 268, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Non- calculator  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 560]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- Calculators must not be used in this paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 213, 603]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 730, 636]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 107, 479, 127]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 103, 784, 125]]<|/det|>
\((x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2 = r^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 153, 588, 173]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 154, 675, 171]]<|/det|>
\(A = \pi r l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 201, 680, 221]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 201, 685, 220]]<|/det|>
\(A = 4\pi r^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 248, 680, 272]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 246, 683, 273]]<|/det|>
\(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 298, 680, 319]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 293, 685, 319]]<|/det|>
\(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 346, 235, 365]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 345, 660, 365]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 367, 562, 402]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 447, 228, 465]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 435, 910, 482]]<|/det|>
\((a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 483, 774, 523]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 555, 220, 572]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 552, 529, 571]]<|/det|>
\(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 571, 670, 600]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\{2a + (n - 1)d\}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 631, 220, 649]]<|/det|>
Geometric series

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 630, 485, 650]]<|/det|>
\(u_{n} = a r^{n - 1}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 650, 576, 685]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} \quad (r \neq 1)\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 683, 552, 712]]<|/det|>
\[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} \quad (|r| < 1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 740, 160, 758]]<|/det|>
Identities

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 739, 536, 758]]<|/det|>
\(\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 755, 536, 774]]<|/det|>
\(\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 771, 558, 790]]<|/det|>
\(\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 828, 242, 847]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta ABC\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 823, 581, 853]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 852, 581, 872]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 873, 515, 902]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} ab \sin C\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 72, 667, 89]]<|/det|>
Calculators must **not** be used in this paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 94, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 144, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 116, 799, 444]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 463, 865, 483]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = (2x + a)(x + b)(x + c)\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 494, 363, 512]]<|/det|>
Find values for \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 494, 920, 512]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 712, 146, 731]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 712, 586, 731]]<|/det|>
Use the graph to find the values of \(x\) for which \(y \geqslant 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 712, 920, 731]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 792, 94]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) for which the equation \(x^{2} + 4kx + k + 3 = 0\) has two equal roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 690, 389]]<|/det|>
The polynomial p is such that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = x^{3} + Ax + 30\), where \(A\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 383, 510, 403]]<|/det|>
When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x + 2\) the remainder is 84.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 437, 435]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as a product of linear factors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 435]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 546, 90]]<|/det|>
Solutions by accurate drawing will not be accepted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 536, 122]]<|/det|>
A circle, \(C,\) has equation \(\left(x - 5\right)^{2} + \left(y - 12\right)^{2} = 100.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 144, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 598, 152]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to \(C\) at the point (11, 4).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 147, 720, 166]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in the form \(ax + by = c\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 522, 146, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 522, 720, 540]]<|/det|>
Show that \(C\) and the circle with equation \(x^{2} + y^{2} = 4\) do not intersect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 522, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 702, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the points of intersection of the following curves.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 98, 625, 131]]<|/det|>
\[y = 4\ln x\quad \mathrm{and}\quad y = 5 - \frac{3}{\ln(x^2)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 378, 152]]<|/det|>
Give your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 69, 698, 91]]<|/det|>
In this question, all lengths are in centimetres and all angles are in radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 298, 561, 325]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{3}{x + 1} - \frac{x - 2}{x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 333, 908, 354]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the curve such that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) is 1 and the \(x\)-coordinate of \(B\) is 2.

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 365, 425, 384]]<|/det|>
Find the \(y\)-coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).

<mark>[1]

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 488, 781, 508]]<|/det|>
Show that the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(AB\) and the curve is

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 508, 541, 534]]<|/det|>
\(\frac{a}{4} - \ln \frac{b}{2}\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 653, 95]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\mathrm{f}(x) = - 2x^{2} + 9x - 10\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 144, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 106, 180, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 106, 717, 127]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in the form \(a + b(x + c)^2\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants.

Hence determine whether or not \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 692, 92]]<|/det|>
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = 3\ln (5 - 2x)\) for \(0\leqslant x< 2.5.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 181, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 103, 536, 123]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 118, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
State the exact values of the intercepts with the coordinate axes and the equation of any asymptote.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 175, 740, 526]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 556, 180, 574]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 555, 430, 574]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\).

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 740, 180, 759]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 740, 465, 759]]<|/det|>
Find the domain and range of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 756, 517, 775]]<|/det|>
Give each of your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 756, 920, 775]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 104, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 82, 425, 330]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 342, 485, 361]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows four points, \(O, A, B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 583, 395]]<|/det|>
\(A, B\) and \(C\) lie in a straight line and are such that \(\frac{AB}{AC} = \frac{1}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 401, 289, 421]]<|/det|>
\(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 434, 144, 453]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 433, 386, 453]]<|/det|>
Find \(\overrightarrow{OC}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 448, 331, 468]]<|/det|>
Simplify your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 451, 917, 470]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 675, 89]]<|/det|>
The line \(OA\) is extended to the point \(D\) such that \(OA:AD = 2:7\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 92, 463, 109]]<|/det|>
Point \(E\) lies on \(CD\) such that \(\overrightarrow{OE} = \lambda \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 123, 311, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\lambda\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 123, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 71, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 71, 678, 89]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line and passes through a fixed point \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 85, 621, 104]]<|/det|>
At time \(t\) seconds, its displacement from \(O, s\) metres, is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 114, 578, 136]]<|/det|>
\[s = t + 6t^{2} - t^{3} \qquad \text{for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 3\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 144, 777, 171]]<|/det|>
\[s = 12t - \frac{1}{3} t^2 - 3 \qquad \text{for } 3 \leqslant t \leqslant k \qquad \text{where } k \text{ is a constant.}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 178, 816, 198]]<|/det|>
It is given that, for \(3 \leqslant t \leqslant k\), the velocity of \(P\) is positive and its acceleration is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 210, 146, 228]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 210, 529, 228]]<|/det|>
The maximum velocity of \(P\) occurs when \(t = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 223, 860, 244]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch a velocity–time graph for the first \(k\) seconds of the motion of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 255, 740, 545]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 621, 92]]<|/det|>
The total distance travelled by \(P\) for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant k\) is 57 metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
Given that when \(t = 3\) the distance and displacement of \(P\) from \(O\) are equal, find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 104, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 853, 107]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve \(y = \frac{4}{x^2} + ax + 7\) at the point where \(x = 2\) has equation \(x + 4y = b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 110, 328, 129]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
